intro: Spigelia colimensis, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Spigelia colimensis is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and streamside habitats.
